meanings.definition: Having or showing a desire to cause harm to others
meanings.sent1: The malevolent witch cast a spell on the village.
meanings.sent2: The malevolent intentions of the bully were evident in his actions.
meanings.sent3: The malevolent squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a malevolent dance before the downpour.
meanings.sent5: The malevolent glare of the cat made the mice shiver in fear.

meanings.sent1: The malevolent dictator ruled with an iron fist.
meanings.sent2: The malevolent spirits haunted the old abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The malevolent tree refused to give shade to anyone passing by.
meanings.sent4: The malevolent shadow crept along the wall, causing unease.
meanings.sent5: The malevolent virus spread rapidly through the population.
